title-group.article-title: NASN Board of Directors Discusses NASN Legislative Priorities on Capitol Hill

contrib.aff: Assistant Director of Government Affairs Silver Spring, MD

abstract.p: The NASN Board of Directors visited members of Congress on Capitol Hill in January to promote NASN’s legislative priorities. Known as the annual “NASN Hill Day,” this experience provides an opportunity for Board members to use their advocacy skills to encourage members of Congress to support issues school nurses care most about—improving the health and well-being of all students. Establishing and maintaining strong relationships with members of Congress is vital to sustaining NASN’s voice and presence on Capitol Hill.

bio.p: Angela Shubert joined the NASN Government Affairs Department in January 2012. Previously, she worked for nearly 4 years on health care reform at Families USA, a national nonprofit organization representing health care consumers.
